class.name: Word.CustomXmlNode
class.description: Represents an XML node in a tree in the document. The CustomXmlNode object is a member of the Word.CustomXmlNodeCollection object: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.customxmlnodecollection

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: Gets a CustomXmlNodeCollection object representing the attributes of the current element in the current node.

properties.name: baseName
properties.description: Gets the base name of the node without the namespace prefix, if one exists.

properties.name: childNodes
properties.description: Gets a CustomXmlNodeCollection object containing all of the child elements of the current node.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: firstChild
properties.description: Gets a CustomXmlNode object corresponding to the first child element of the current node. If the node has no child elements (or if it isn't of type CustomXmlNodeType.element), returns `Nothing`.

properties.name: lastChild
properties.description: Gets a CustomXmlNode object corresponding to the last child element of the current node. If the node has no child elements (or if it isn't of type CustomXmlNodeType.element), the property returns `Nothing`.

properties.name: namespaceUri
properties.description: Gets the unique address identifier for the namespace of the node.

properties.name: nextSibling
properties.description: Gets the next sibling node (element, comment, or processing instruction) of the current node. If the node is the last sibling at its level, the property returns `Nothing`.

properties.name: nodeType
properties.description: Gets the type of the current node.

properties.name: nodeValue
properties.description: Specifies the value of the current node.

properties.name: ownerPart
properties.description: Gets the object representing the part associated with this node.

properties.name: parentNode
properties.description: Gets the parent element node of the current node. If the current node is at the root level, the property returns `Nothing`.

properties.name: previousSibling
properties.description: Gets the previous sibling node (element, comment, or processing instruction) of the current node. If the current node is the first sibling at its level, the property returns `Nothing`.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Specifies the text for the current node.

properties.name: xml
properties.description: Gets the XML representation of the current node and its children.

properties.name: xpath
properties.description: Gets a string with the canonicalized XPath for the current node. If the node is no longer in the Document Object Model (DOM), the property returns an error message.

methods.name: appendChildNode
methods.description: Appends a single node as the last child under the context element node in the tree.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. The options that define the node to be appended.

methods.name: appendChildSubtree
methods.description: Adds a subtree as the last child under the context element node in the tree.

params.name: xml
params.description: A string representing the XML subtree.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the current node from the tree (including all of its children, if any exist).

methods.name: hasChildNodes
methods.description: Specifies if the current element node has child element nodes.

methods.name: insertNodeBefore
methods.description: Inserts a new node just before the context node in the tree.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. The options that define the node to be inserted.

methods.name: insertSubtreeBefore
methods.description: Inserts the specified subtree into the location just before the context node.

params.name: xml
params.description: A string representing the XML subtree.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. The options available for inserting the subtree.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: removeChild
methods.description: Removes the specified child node from the tree.

methods.name: replaceChildNode
methods.description: Removes the specified child node and replaces it with a different node in the same location.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. The options that define the child node which is to replace the old node.

methods.name: replaceChildSubtree
methods.description: Removes the specified node and replaces it with a different subtree in the same location.

params.name: xml
params.description: A string representing the new subtree.

methods.name: selectNodes
methods.description: Selects a collection of nodes matching an XPath expression.

methods.name: selectSingleNode
methods.description: Selects a single node from a collection matching an XPath expression.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.CustomXmlNode` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.CustomXmlNodeData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.
